paragraph: CHAPTER 65.

After returning twice for water, to satisfy those in the house, Mr Seagrave came to the assistance of William, who had been removing Ready's clothes to ascertain the nature of the wound he had received.
tokens: return water satisfy house come assistance remove ready clothes ascertain nature wound receive

paragraph: "We had better move him to where the other cocoa-nut boughs lie; he will be more comfortable there," said William.
tokens: have good move other cocoa nut bough lie comfortable say

paragraph: Ready whispered, "More water."  William gave him some more and then, with the assistance of his father, Ready was removed to a more comfortable place.  As soon as they laid him there, Ready turned on his side, and threw up a quantity of blood.
tokens: ready whisper more water give more assistance father ready remove comfortable place lay ready turn side throw quantity blood

paragraph: "I am better now," said he in a low voice; "bind up the wound, William; an old man like me has not much blood to spare."
tokens: good say low voice bind wound old man have much blood spare

paragraph: Mr Seagrave and William then examined the wound; the spear had gone deep into the lungs.  William threw off his shirt, tore it up into strips, and then bound up the wound so as to stop the effusion of blood.
tokens: examine wound spear go lung throw shirt tore strip bind wound stop effusion blood

paragraph: Ready, who at first appeared much exhausted with being moved about, gradually recovered so as to be able to speak in a low voice, when Mrs Seagrave came out of the house.
tokens: ready appear exhaust move recover able speak low voice come house

paragraph: "Where is that brave, kind man?" cried she, "that I may bless him and thank him."
tokens: brave kind man cry bless thank

paragraph: Mr Seagrave went to her, and caught her by the arm.  "He is hurt, my dear; and very much hurt.  I did not tell you at the time."
tokens: go catch arm hurt dear hurt tell time

paragraph: Mr Seagrave related what had occurred, and then led her to where Ready was lying.  Mrs Seagrave knelt by his side, took his hand, and burst into tears.
tokens: relate occur lead ready lie knolt side take hand burst tear

paragraph: "Don't weep for me," said Ready; "my days have been numbered; I'm only sorry that I cannot any more be useful to you."
tokens: weep say ready day numbered sorry useful

paragraph: "Dear good man," said Mrs Seagrave, "whatever may be our fates, and that is for the Almighty to decide for us, as long as I have life, what you have done for me and mine shall never be forgotten."
tokens: dear good man say fate decide have life do forget

paragraph: Mrs Seagrave then bent over him, and kissing his forehead, rose and retired weeping into the house.
tokens: bend kiss forehead rise retire weep house

paragraph: "William," said Ready, "I can't talk now; raise my head a little, and then leave me.  You have not looked round lately.  Come again in about half an hour.  Leave me now, Mr Seagrave; I shall be better if I doze a little."
tokens: say ready talk raise head little leave look come hour leave good do little

paragraph: They complied with Ready's request; went up to the planks, and examined carefully all round the stockade; at last they stopped.
tokens: complie request go plank examine stockade last stop

paragraph: "This is a sad business, William," said Mr Seagrave.
tokens: sad business say

paragraph: William shook his head.  "He would not let me go," replied he; "I wish he had.  I fear that he is much hurt."
tokens: shake head let go reply wish have fear hurt

paragraph: "I should say that he cannot recover, William.  We shall miss him to-morrow if they attack us."
tokens: say recover miss attack

paragraph: "I hardly know what to say, papa; but I feel that since we have been relieved, I am able to do twice as much as I could have done before."
tokens: know say papa feel relieve able do much do

paragraph: "I feel the same, but still with such a force against us, two people cannot do much."
tokens: feel same force person do much

paragraph: "If my mother and Juno load the muskets for us," replied William, "we shall at all events do as much now as we should have been able to do if there were three, so exhausted as we should have been."
tokens: mother load musket reply event do able do be exhausted

paragraph: "Perhaps so; at all events we will do our best, for we fight for our lives and for those most dear to us."
tokens: event do good fight life dear

paragraph: William went softly up to Ready, and found that he was dozing; he therefore did not disturb him, but returned to his father.  Now that their thirst had been appeased, they all felt the calls of hunger.  Juno and William went and cut off steaks from the turtle, and fried them; they all made a hearty meal, and perhaps never had they taken one with so much relish in their lives.
tokens: go ready find doze disturb return father thirst appease feel call hunger go cut steak turtle fry make hearty meal take much relish life

paragraph: It was nearly daylight, when William, who had several times been softly up to Ready, found him with his eyes open.
tokens: daylight have several time ready find eye open

paragraph: "How do you find yourself, Ready?" said William.
tokens: find ready say

paragraph: "I am quiet and easy, William, and without much pain; but I think I am sinking, and shall not last long.  Recollect that if you are obliged to escape from the stockade, you take no heed of me, but leave me where I am.  I cannot live, and were you to move me, I should only die the sooner."
tokens: quiet easy much pain think sink last recollect oblige escape stockade take heed leave live move die

paragraph: "I had rather die with you, than leave you, Ready."
tokens: die leave ready

paragraph: "No, that is wrong; you must save your mother, and your brothers and sister; promise me that you will do as I wish."
tokens: wrong save mother brother sister promise do wish

paragraph: William hesitated.
tokens: hesitate

paragraph: "I point out to you your duty, William.  I know what your feelings are, but you must not give way to them; promise me this, or you will make me very miserable."
tokens: point duty know feeling give way promise make miserable

paragraph: William squeezed Ready's hand; his heart was too full to speak.
tokens: squeeze hand heart full speak

paragraph: "They will come at daylight, William; you have not much time to spare; climb to the look-out, and wait there till day dawns; watch them as long as you can, and then come and tell me what you have seen."
tokens: come daylight have much time spare climb look wait day dawn watch come tell see

paragraph: Ready's voice became faint after this exertion of speaking so much.
tokens: ready voice become faint exertion speak

paragraph: William immediately climbed up the cocoa-nut tree, and waited there till daylight.  At the dawn of day, he perceived that the savages were at work, that they had collected all the faggots together opposite to where the old house had stood, and were very busy in making arrangements for the attack.  At last, every one shouldered a faggot, and commenced their advance towards the stockade; William immediately descended and called his father, who was talking with Mrs Seagrave.  The muskets were all loaded, and Mrs Seagrave and Juno took their posts below the planking, to reload them as fast as they were fired.
tokens: climb cocoa nut tree wait daylight dawn day perceive savage work collect faggot old house stand busy make arrangement attack last one shoulder faggot commence advance stockade descend call father talk musket load take post planking reload fire

paragraph: "We must fire upon them as soon as we are sure of not missing, William," said Mr Seagrave, "for the more we check their advance, the better."
tokens: fire sure miss say check advance good

paragraph: When the first savages were within fifty yards, they both fired, and two of the men dropped; they continued to fire as their assailants came up, with great success for the first ten minutes; after which the savages advanced in a larger body, and took the precaution to hold the faggots in front of them, for some protection as they approached.  By these means they gained the stockade in safety, and commenced laying their faggots.  Mr Seagrave and William still kept up an incessant fire upon them, but not with so much success as before.
tokens: first savage yard fire man drop continue fire assailant come great success first minute savage advance large body take precaution hold faggot front protection approach mean gain stockade safety commence lay faggot keep incessant fire much success

paragraph: Although many fell, the faggots were gradually heaped up, till they almost reached to the holes between the palisades, through which they pointed their muskets; and as the savages contrived to slope them down from the stockade to the ground, it was evident that they meant to mount up and take them by escalade.  At last, it appeared as if all the faggots had been placed, and the savages retired farther back, to where the cocoa-nut trees were still standing.
tokens: many fall faggot heap reach hole palisadd point musket savage contrive slope stockade ground evident mean mount take escalade last appear faggot place savage retire cocoa nut tree stand

paragraph: "They have gone away, father," said William; "but they will come again, and I fear it is all over with us."
tokens: go father say come fear

paragraph: "I fear so too, my boy," replied Mr Seagrave; "they are only retreating to arrange for a general assault, and they now will be able to gain an entrance.  I almost wish that they had fired the faggots; we might have escaped as Ready pointed out to us, but now I fear we have no chance."
tokens: fear boy reply retreat arrange general assault able gain entrance wish fire faggot escape ready point fear have chance

paragraph: "Don't say a word to my mother," said William; "let us defend ourselves to the last, and if we are overpowered it is the will of God."
tokens: say word mother say let defend last overpower will

paragraph: "I should like to take a farewell embrace of your dear mother," said Mr Seagrave; "but, no; it will be weakness just now.  Here they come, William, in a swarm.  Well, God bless you, my boy; we shall all, I trust, meet in Heaven!"
tokens: like take farewell embrace dear mother say weakness come swarm bless boy trust meet

paragraph: The whole body of savages were now advancing from the cocoa-nut wood in a solid mass; they raised a yell, which struck terror into the hearts of Mrs Seagrave and Juno, yet they flinched not.  The savages were again within fifty yards of them, when the fire was opened upon them; the fire was answered by loud yells, and the savages had already reached to the bottom of the sloping pile of faggots, when the yells and the reports of the muskets were drowned by a much louder report, followed by the crackling and breaking of the cocoa-nut trees, which made both parties start with surprise; another and another followed, the ground was ploughed up, and the savages fell in numbers.
tokens: whole body savage advance cocoa nut wood solid mass raise yell strike terror heart flinch savage yard fire open fire answer loud yell savage reach bottom slope pile faggot yell report musket drown louder report follow crackling breaking cocoa nut tree make party start surprise follow ground plough savage fall number

paragraph: "It must be the cannon of a ship, father," said William; "we are saved-- we are saved!"
tokens: cannon ship father say save save

paragraph: "It can be nothing else; we are saved, and by a miracle!" replied Mr Seagrave in utter astonishment.
tokens: else save miracle reply utter astonishment

paragraph: The savages paused in the advance, quite stupefied; again, again, again, the report of the loud guns boomed through the air, and the round-shot and grape came whizzing and tearing through the cocoa-nut grove; at this last broadside, the savages turned, and fled towards their canoes: not one was left to be seen.
tokens: savage pause advance stupefy report loud gun boom air round shot grape come whizz tear cocoa nut grove last broadside savage turn flead canoe leave see

paragraph: "We are saved!" cried Mr Seagrave, leaping off the plank and embracing his wife, who sank down on her knees, and held up her clasped hands in thankfulness to Heaven.
tokens: save cry leap plank embrace wife sink knee hold clasp hand thankfulness

paragraph: William had hastened up to the look-out on the cocoa-nut tree, and now cried out to them below, as the guns were again discharged:
tokens: hasten look cocoa nut tree cry gun discharge

paragraph: "A large schooner, father; she is firing at the savages, who are at the canoes; they are falling in every direction: some have plunged into the water; there is a boat full of armed men coming on shore; they are close to the beach, by the garden-point.  Three of the canoes have got off full of men; there go the guns again; two of the canoes are sunk, father; the boat has landed, and the people are coming up this way." William then descended from the look-out as fast as he could.
tokens: large schooner father fire savage canoe fall direction plunge water be boat full armed man come shore close beach garden point canoe get full man go gun canoe sink father boat land person come way descend look

paragraph: As soon as he was down, he commenced unbarring the door of the stockade. He pulled out the last pole just as he heard the feet of their deliverers outside.  He threw open the door, and, a second after, found himself in the arms of Captain Osborn.
tokens: commence unbarr door stockade pull last pole hear foot deliverer throw open door second find arm
